intro: Austroeupatorium laetevirens, commonly known as the bright green eupatorium, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, fluffy white to pale blue flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are typically bright green, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and stream banks. Austroeupatorium laetevirens is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
